results.title: Indonesia
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, University of Queensland Press, Film Australia and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
What makes this diverse chain of islands into a nation? Indonesia’s national motto “Unity in diversity” is the film’s starting point in its concentration on Sumatra, Java and Bali - the most populated areas. One of the most interesting sequences is an examination of the Indonesian concept of power - that there is a finite amount of it in the world. Another highlight is the Indonesian Army and its role as an essential ingredient in society - not, as so often in the West, as something appended to, or imposed on, society.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, University of Queensland Press, Film Australia and ABC

Another highlight is the Indonesian Army and its role as an essential ingredient in society - not, as so often in the West, as something appended to, or imposed on, society.

results.title: Thailand
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Roan Hannam, Don Murray, John Temple, University of Queensland, Film Australia and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”
A look at the historical and cultural background of Thailand. Focuses on the respect the Thais have for the monks and their religion, and the veneration of the monarchy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arch Nicholson, Roan Hannam, Don Murray, John Temple, University of Queensland, Film Australia and ABC

results.title: Blurring the boundaries
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Craig Walsh
results.brief_description: Repurposing documentation of his wild installation, where unexpected images are projected onto a shop window in Vietnam, Craig Walsh captures the interaction between art and its audience.

results.title: Blood disco: Dirk wears white socks
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Scott Redford
results.brief_description: Scott Redford’s visually rampant fist-in-mouth and Egyptian eye images riff on the early surrealist films of Luis Buñuel, via a queer punk aesthetic, in this pop-savvy work.

results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Helen Grace

results.title: Paper War
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Guan Wei
results.brief_description: This simple tracking shot along Guan Wei’s exquisitely drawn battle scenes, silhouetted against a traditional landscape scroll, suggests the right-to-left movement of Chinese reading.
results.description: This simple tracking shot along Guan Wei’s exquisitely drawn battle scenes, silhouetted against a traditional landscape scroll, suggests the right-to-left movement of Chinese reading.

results.title: The Day Before I Went Away
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Guo Jian
results.brief_description: Guo Jian’s saucy and sinister reappropriation of Chinese propaganda painting techniques is heightened by this animation of his allegorical work ‘The Day Before I Went Away’.

results.title: OverDrawn
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Martin Walch
results.brief_description: Martin Walch mixes the toxic beauty of his own photographs with industrial and geographic documentation in this animated pan across an area of the Mt Lyell mine, Tasmania.

results.title: Knit-face
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Janet Merewether
results.brief_description: Janet Merewether’s comic portrait series of knitted dolls illuminates the unpredictable, shabby beauty of found objects and gleefully appreciates the individual, creative application of this traditional craft form.
results.description: Janet Merewether’s comic portrait series of knitted dolls illuminates the unpredictable, shabby beauty of found objects and gleefully appreciates the individual, creative application of this traditional craft form.

results.title: A 30 second portrait, starring Phil Lombardo
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Cherine Fahd
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Cherine Fahd’s loving and gently funny video portrait of Phil Lombardo, a young man obsessed with Michael Jackson, continues her visual investigation into the politics of personal identity.
results.description: Cherine Fahd’s loving and gently funny video portrait of Phil Lombardo, a young man obsessed with Michael Jackson, continues her visual investigation into the politics of personal identity.
description_for_label: Cherine Fahd’s loving and gently funny video portrait of Phil Lombardo, a young man obsessed with Michael Jackson, continues her visual investigation into the politics of personal identity.
